reviews.text: The B and B was very clean and comfortable. Great location just minutes to the town. Very nicely renovated. Though didnt like having breakfast in the room and did feel the breakfast should have been included in the price. Nick was very friendly and welcoming..Just felt the breakfast situation let the place down.
reviews.title: Comfortable Room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked the Tower Suite for 2 nights to attend a friends wedding in Newquay. My first criticism lies with the title of this room, for room is all it was and not a suite as the name suggests. However, the room is nicely decorated and the ensuite bathroom is lovely with jacuzzi bath and shower over bath. Trouble was we could not get any hot water from either bath or shower. Could not use the bath at all as water was almost cold. Had to just have very bracing shower. The owner did do his best to fix it for us but to no avail. When I decided to have warming cup of tea after shower I found that the tea bags (which were just loose on a tray) looked very old and pretty sad looking so had to have coffee instead. There is no dining room so if you want breakfast it is served to the room at a charge of £5.00 per head. My husband ordered breakfast, which was standard English, it came with a jug of orange juice but no tea or coffee. At the cost of £5.00 he expected at least a decent cup of coffee and not just the little pack of instant provided in the room. All day breakfasts are served in a cafe just around the corner for £1.99 and come with real coffee and free refils. It was a shame these things let the place down as it has the potential to be a super B&B.
reviews.title: Not the best B&B I have stayed at but far from worst.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having said all of the above, the bed was very comfortable and there was no street noise as the room is to the back. The standard of cleanliness was very high.
reviews.title: was ok but..........

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we arrived we was standing outside for ages as there was no one in to greet us. The Owner seemed too eager to get the money off us even before we had seen the room. Dispite phoning the hotel before hand to inform them that we only wanted to have the 3 nights instead of 4 due to medical reasons. He seemed pretty desperate, telling me all about his financial worries. Not acceptable. States that its a 4 star on web when its a 3 outside the Lodge.
reviews.title: We really liked it but a few improvements needed

reviews.text: Even knocked on our room door when we were undressed, to take the money for the night we were not going to stay.
reviews.title: great place in ideal location

reviews.text: We were a group of three girls traveling down to newquasy for my 21st birthday. Friendly family, nice welcome. rooms were very clean and tidy. bed was comfy. Didnt have the breakfast in the morning, but i think it is good that they bring it to you rooms. It was easy to get in and out of the hotel when you wanted to, garanteed you have to be quiet. was not a problem. would definatly come again! and recomend this guest house to couples or familys. thank you.
reviews.title: Very nice guest house.

reviews.text: Having stayed at Cotehele lodge several times previously we were looking to our holiday with our teenage sons in August. Nick and Sonja's welcome has always been so warm and sincere making us feel welcome and comfortable.
reviews.title: just go there

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having spoke to Nick prior we knew that Cotehele had recently undergone a refurbishment. However nothing prepared us for the surprise on our arrival.What a superb transformation. This establishment must now rank among Newquays premier establishments.
reviews.title: Perfect accomodation in the perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The thought and quality of the furnishings and decor has to be experienced to be appreciated. Cotehele lodge is traditional but through meticulous planning has a contemporary refreshing aura. What is wonderfully absent however is that sometimes souless feeling that pervades some businesses vying for the upper sector of the hotel market.
reviews.title: Incredible accommodation in Newquay!!!

reviews.text: I absolutely could not fault our stay with its superb welcome, facilities and location. We left feeling rejuvenated and content. For those wanting a special holiday at very reasonable rates you absolutely be entralled with cotehele. Cant wait for our next visit(s)
reviews.title: ONE OF THE BEST GUEST HOUSES IN NEWQUAY!!

reviews.text: We have stained with Nicky and Sonia on several occasions, and have always found up warm and friendly welcome. The accommodation and breakfasts are excellent, with adequate parking. The harbour and town are within easy walking distance, with the fistrule breach right opposite, this is an ideal base to explore Cornwall.
reviews.title: Excellent in every way

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spacious room with four poster bed. Located next to Fistral beach and close to centre of Newquay. Friendly, helpful owner. The room wasn't as clean as we would have liked and wasn't cleaned at all during our 6 day stay. Small touches were missing like teaspoons and shower gel and a menu for breakfast! Only one hand towel provided. 6/10.
reviews.title: Nice location in Newquay

reviews.text: We enjoyed the spacious room with four-poster bed and a comfortable bed-sofa as well as the friendly service and the excellent breakfast. Beaches, shops and pubs are within easy walking distance. Thank you, Nick, for making our stay in Newquay a special one.
reviews.title: Excellent place to stay

reviews.text: Coethele Lodge was very easy to find and is possibly one of the only B&B's in the area to offer their own off road parking. The owner and their family were very helpfuly and welcoming. We had a large room that had a sea view and was big enough for our two childrens blow up beds and was very clean and well presented. They offered a large selection at breakfast time and even offered to do non menu items for the children.
reviews.title: Very freindly and welcoming and an excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were located just 5mins walk from Newquays main surf beach (fistral) and 10 mins walk from all the town had to offer.
reviews.title: fantastic place to stay

reviews.text: My partner and i stayed at cotehele lodge for a week and we both had a brilliant time. The owners of the lodge were very welcoming and friendly.The breakfasts were very nice and easily filled you up until dinner and there was a wide selection to choose from not just a full english!!We will definately be going back.
reviews.title: The best hosts ever!
